names: Diagnostic arthroscopy of the shoulder joint (Evidence: pg no: 13, L437)
description: Diagnostic arthroscopy of the shoulder joint is considered medically necessary for synovial biopsy or tissue harvest (chondrocyte), or when the involved joint meets ALL of the following criteria. (Evidence: pg no: 13, L437-L438)
scope: This guideline addresses shoulder arthroscopy and open procedures when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L373-L374)

documentation: Presence of ONE of the following symptoms: Significant pain and functional limitation, Instability (e.g., giving way, catching, clicking, locking), Limited range of motion (Evidence: pg no: 13, L439-L442)

Presence of ONE of the following physical exam findings: Limited range of motion, Joint swelling, Inconclusive specific diagnostic exam maneuvers, Local muscle weakness or atrophy (Evidence: pg no: 13, L443-L447)
Inconclusive x-ray and/or advanced imaging studies (Evidence: pg no: 14, L448-L449)
Failure of at least 6 weeks of conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 14, L450)

exclusions: In-office diagnostic arthroscopy (e.g., mi-eye 2Â®) (Evidence: pg no: 14, L452)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, shoulder, diagnostic, with or without synovial biopsy (separate procedure) (Evidence: pg no: 20, L720)

notes: All arthroscopic procedures of the shoulder are inclusive of diagnostic arthroscopy and manipulation under anesthesia. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L375-L376)
